ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
Does your child look at you when you call his/her name?
Notes: 0 = Always; 1 = usually; 2 = sometimes; 3 = rarely; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: How easy is it for you to get eye contact with your child?
Notes: 0 = very easy; 1 = quite easy; 2 = quite difficult; 3 = very difficult; 4 = impossible; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: When your child is playing alone, does s/he line objects up?
Notes: 0 = always; 1 = usually; 2 = sometimes; 3 = rarely; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Can other people easily understand your child's speech?
Notes: 0 = always; 1 = usually; 2 = sometimes; 3 = rarely; 4 = never or "my child does not speak"; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child point to indicate that s/he wants something (e.g. a toy that is out of reach)?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child point to share interest with you (e.g. pointing at an interesting sight)?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: How long can your child's interest be maintained by a spinning object (e.g. washing machine, electric fan, toy car wheels)?
Notes: 0 = several hours; 1 = half an hour; 2 = ten minutes; 3 = a couple of minutes; 4 = less than a minute; -998 = Refused to answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: How many words can your child say?
Notes: 0 = none - s/he has not started speaking yet; 1 = less than 10 words; 2 = 10 - 50 words; 3 = 51 - 100 words; 4 = over 100 words; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child pretend (e.g. care for dolls, talk on a toy phone)?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child follow where you're looking?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: How often does your child sniff or lick unusual objects?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child place your hand on an object when s/he wants you to use (e.g. on a door handle when s/he wants you to open the door, on a toy when s/he wants you to activate it)?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child walk on tiptoe?
Notes: 0 = Always; 1 = usually; 2 = sometimes; 3 = rarely; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: How easy is it for your child to adapt when his/her routine changes or when things are out of their usual place?
Notes: 0 = very easy; 1 = quite easy; 2 = quite difficult; 3 = very difficult; 4 = impossible; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: If you or someone else in the family is visibly upset, does your child show signs of wanting to comfort them (e.g. stroking their hair, hugging them)?
Notes: 0 = Always; 1 = usually; 2 = sometimes; 3 = rarely; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child do the same thing over and over again (e.g. running the tap, turning the light switch on and off, opening and closing doors)?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Would you describe your child's first words as:
Notes: 0 = very typical; 1 = quite typical; 2 = slightly unusual; 3 = very unusual; 4 = my child doesn't speak; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child echo things s/he hears (e.g. things that you say, lines from songs or movies, sounds)?
Notes: 0 = 0; 1 = 1; 2 = 2; 3 = 3; 4 = 4; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child use simple gestures (e.g. wave goodbye)?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child make unusual finger movements near his/her eyes?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child spontaneously look at your face to check your reaction when faced with something unfamiliar?
Notes: 0 = Always; 1 = usually; 2 = sometimes; 3 = rarely; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: How long can your child's interest be maintained by just one or two objects?
Notes: 0 = most of the day; 1 = several hours; 2 = half an hour; 3 = ten minutes; 4 = a couple of minutes; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your twiddle objects repetitively (e.g. pieces of string)?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child seem oversensitive to noise?
Notes: 0 = Always; 1 = usually; 2 = sometimes; 3 = rarely; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Does your child stare at nothing with no apparent purpose?
Notes: 0 = many times a day; 1 = a few times a day; 2 = a few times a week; 3 = less than once a week; 4 = never; -998 = Refused to Answer or said NA; -999 = Did not answer

ElementDescription: Total QCHAT Score
